rows.Title: VoNR toggle button is not showing in Network menu for Jio/Airtel.
rows.Problem: Go to settings > Connections > Mobile Network > Observe. VoNR toggle button is not available for Jio or Airtel. Expected result: VoNR toggle button should be available under Network menu.
rows.Summarized Problem: VoNR toggle button is missing in Network menu for Jio and Airtel.
rows.Severity Reason: Feature missing prevents users from enabling VoNR on supported networks.

rows.Title: Data icon shows 4G while Device upper layer Indicator set 1
rows.Problem: SIM1: Airtel. Device in idle state until 4G data icon displays. Dial *#0011# to check. Data icon shows 4G while upper layer indicator is set to 1. Expected: when indicator is 1, data icon should show 5G Hollow. Data not in use should show 4G.
rows.Summarized Problem: Data icon shows 4G when upper layer indicator is set to 1, violating expected 5G Hollow display for 5G Bold.
rows.Severity Reason: Always occurs during data access, violates expected behavior for 5G indicator.

rows.Title: Data icon shows 4G while Device upper layer Indicator set 1
rows.Problem: Access data using SIM1 (Airtel) in idle state until 4G data icon displays. Dial *#0011# to check. Data icon shows 4G while upper layer indicator is set to 1. Expected: upper layer indicator 1 should show 5G Bold or 5G Hollow, not 4G.
rows.Summarized Problem: Data icon shows 4G when upper layer indicator is set to 1, violating expected 5G indicator behavior.
rows.Severity Reason: Always occurs during data access, blocks correct 5G indicator display, critical for network usability.

rows.Title: Unable to retrive the Call screen from Notification panel

rows.Summarized Problem: Call screen cannot be retrieved from notification panel when tapping the Call icon.

rows.Title: Unable to turn on JIO Esim

rows.Title: Wifi auto delatch & re-latch observed

rows.Summarized Problem: Wifi auto delatch and re-latch occurs during idle state, violating expected behavior.
rows.Severity Reason: Issue occurs intermittently and affects stable Wifi calling operation.

rows.Title: DUT remains in Emergency Calls only state post Panic Call
rows.Problem: Precondition: SIM1: Airtel. Occurrence: 1. Make a Panic Call by pressing power button 3 times > wait > observe. 2. Do Flight MODE ON/OFF > observe. Occurrence status: 1. DUT unable to connect call to Emergency Number. 2. During call establish, DUT falls back to 2G and then Emergency Call only state. 3. DUT stays in Emergency Call screen for long time. 4. After terminating the call, DUT unable to re-latch to NW. 5. DUT latches to NW post Flight mode ON/OFF. Expected result: 1. DUT should connect to Emergency number. 2. DUT should not stay for long time in Emergency Call screen. 3. DUT should latch to NW post Emergency call ends.
rows.Summarized Problem: DUT fails to connect to emergency number and remains in emergency call state after panic call, unable to re-establish network connection afterward.
rows.Severity Reason: Failure to establish emergency call connection and subsequent network latching issues affect core functionality.

rows.Title: DUT remains in Emergency Calls only state post Panic Call
rows.Problem: Precondition: SIM1: Airtel. Occurrence: 1. Make a Panic Call by pressing power button 3 times > wait > observe. 2. Do Flight MODE ON/OFF > observe. Occurrence status: 1. DUT unable to connect call to Emergency Number. 2. During call establish, DUT falls back to 2G and then Emergency Call only state. 3. DUT stays in Emergency Call screen for long time. 4. After terminating the call, DUT unable to re-latch to NW. 5. DUT latches to NW post Flight mode ON/OFF. Expected result: 1. DUT should connect to Emergency number. 2. DUT should not stay for long time in Emergency Call screen. 3. DUT should latch to NW post Emergency call ends.
rows.Summarized Problem: DUT fails to connect to emergency number and remains in emergency call state after panic call, unable to re-establish network connection.
rows.Severity Reason: DUT fails to establish emergency call and cannot re-latch to network after call ends, impacting core functionality.

rows.Title: VoWifi DUT fall back to 2G NW when receive the MT Call

rows.Summarized Problem: DUT falls back to 2G when receiving MT call over VoWifi, despite Wi-Fi preference.
rows.Severity Reason: Issue occurs during call setup, preventing VoWifi functionality under expected conditions.

rows.Title: Call ViLTE DUT able to accept the ViLTE Call Request from Cross Operator.
rows.Problem: Precondition: SIM1: Airtel SIM2: Vi [DUT1] [SIM1: 9289813600 SIM2: 8506089454] SIM1: Airtel SIM2: Jio [DUT2] [SIM1: 8448792661 SIM2: 8178698756] Data switching and backup calling must be ON. DDS must be set to SIM1 for both DUT1 & 2. Occurrence process: 1. Make MO Call from DUT1 SIM2[Vi] to DUT2 SIM1[Airtel] > from DUT1, tap on Video call Request > Accept it at DUT2 > Observe. 2. from DUT1 to DUT2 initiate a ViLTE call > Observe ViLTE call is able to possible at DUT2 also. Occurrence status: 1. Video Call button is showing for Cross Operator VoLTE Call. 2. DUT2 is able to accept the Cal successfully. 3. Cross Operator (Vi<>Airtel) ViLTE Call is possible. Expected result: 1. ViLTE Call option should get disable during call for Cross Operator. 2. If ViLTE Call request initiate from any Operator, it should get auto rejected as other Operator's ViLTE Call is in Disable state. 3. If any Cross Operator initiate a ViLTE Call, other End should receive the VoLTE Call instead of ViLTE Call.
rows.Summarized Problem: ViLTE call option remains active during cross-operator calls and should be disabled; calls should be routed to VoLTE instead.
rows.Severity Reason: ViLTE call functionality fails to disable during cross-operator calls and is misrouted to VoLTE.

rows.Title: Samsung pass is temporarily not available popup coming while creating passkey

rows.Title: Ongoing VoLTE call of SIM1 gets on hold when try to make video call with SIM2

rows.Summarized Problem: VoLTE call on SIM1 gets on hold when attempting to make a video call with SIM2.
rows.Severity Reason: Issue occurs always during call switching between SIMs, blocks feature usage but does not cause crash or data loss.

rows.Title: SIM Selection window is not showing for preferred SIM card & recently used sim card
rows.Problem: Precondition: SIM 1 & SIM 2 inserted, SIM1 set for call. Expected: Window should display for preferred and recently used SIM cards.
rows.Summarized Problem: SIM Selection window fails to display for preferred and recently used SIM cards during call transitions.
rows.Severity Reason: Issue occurs always and blocks SIM switching functionality during call operations.
